annuity.name: Annuity
annuity.description: Principal payment fully at IED and interest plus principal repaid periodically in constant amounts till MD. If variable rate, total amount for interest and principal is recalculated to be fully matured at MD.
annuity.coverage: Classical level payment mortgages, leasing contracts etc.

callMoney.name: Call Money
callMoney.description: Loans that are rolled over as long as they are not called. Once called it has to be paid back after the stipulated notice period.

capFloor.name: Cap Floors
capFloor.description: Interest rate option expressed in a maximum or minimum interest rate.

collateral.name: Collateral
collateral.description: Collateral creates a relationship between a collateral an obligee and a debtor, covering the exposure from the debtor with the collateral.
collateral.coverage: Mortgages include a collateral contract. Any coverage with financial or physical collateral.

commodity.name: Commodity
commodity.description: This is not a financial contract in its propper sense. However it traks movements of commodities such as oil, gas or even houses. Such commodities can serve as underlyings of commodity futures, guarantees or simply asset positions.

convertibleNote.name: Convertible Note
convertibleNote.description: Bonds with a call or put option. If option is exercised, underlying bond ceases to exist.
convertibleNote.coverage: Callable and puttable bonds or loans.

creditDefaultSwap.name: Credit Default Swap
creditDefaultSwap.description: A payment is triggered if one or more of the ndelying counterparties defaults.
creditDefaultSwap.coverage: All sorts of credit default swaps

creditLinkedNote.name: Credit Linked Note
creditLinkedNote.description: A credit linked note is a security with an embedded CDSWP

eXOTi.name: EXOTi
eXOTi.description: As of current, most of the exotic options which were popular before 2008 are out of favor and factually irrelevant.Which of the exotic options will be implemented will depend on the real relevance in the future.
eXOTi.coverage: Knock-in and Knock-out, Barrier, Ladder, Rainbow options etc.

exoticAnnuity.name: Exotic Annuity
exoticAnnuity.description: Exotic version of ANN However step ups with respect to (i) Principal, (ii) Interest rates are possible. Highly flexible to match totally irregular principal payments. Principal can also be paid out in steps.
exoticAnnuity.coverage: A special version of this kind are teaser rate loans and mortgages with annuity features.

exoticLinearAmortizer.name: Exotic Linear Amortizer
exoticLinearAmortizer.description: Exotic version of LAM. However step ups with respect to (i) Principal, (ii) Interest rates are possible. Highly flexible to match totally irregular principal payments. Principal can also be paid out in steps.
exoticLinearAmortizer.coverage: A special version of this kind are teaser rate loans and mortgages.

exoticNegativeAmortizer.name: Exotic Negative Amortizer
exoticNegativeAmortizer.description: Exotic version of NAM However step ups with respect to (i) Principal, (ii) Interest rates are possible. Highly flexible to match totally irregular principal payments. Principal can also be paid out in steps.
exoticNegativeAmortizer.coverage: A special version of this kind are teaser rate loans and mortgages with variable MD.

foreignExchangeOutright.name: Foreign Ex-change Outright
foreignExchangeOutright.description: Two parties agree to exchange two fixed cash flows in different currencies at a certain point in time in future.
foreignExchangeOutright.coverage: Any FX-outright transaction at a future date. This is also the underlying of FX-options and FX futures.

future.name: Future
future.description: Keeps track of value changes for any basic CT as underlying (PAM, ANN etc. but also FXOUT, STK, COM). Handles margining calls.
future.coverage: Standard interest rate, FX, stock and commodity futures.

guarantee.name: Guarantee
guarantee.description: Guarantee creates a relationship between a guarantor, an obligee and a debtor, moving the exposure from the debtor to the guarantor.
guarantee.coverage: Personal guarantee. Government guarantee. Underlyings of CDO´s.

linearAmortizer.name: Linear Amortizer
linearAmortizer.description: Principal payment fully at IED. Principal repaid periodically in constant amounts till MD. Interest gets reduced accordingly. If variable rate, only interest payment is recalculated. Fixed and variable rates.

margining.name: Margining
margining.description: A Margining contract traces the value changes and the different margin categories like inital and variation margin.
margining.coverage: Margin contracts as applied in central depositories for any underlying or portfolio of underlying instruments.

negativeAmortizer.name: Negative Amortizer
negativeAmortizer.description: Similar as ANN. However when resetting rate, total amount (interest plus principal) stay constant. MD shifts. Only variable rates.
negativeAmortizer.coverage: Special class of ARM´s (adjustable rate mortgages), Certain loans.

option.name: Option
option.description: Calculates straight option pay-off for any basic CT as underlying (PAM, ANN etc.) but also SWAPS, FXOUT, STK and COM. Single, periodic and continuous strike is supported.
option.coverage: European, American and Bermudan options with Interest rate, FX and stock futures as underlying instruments.

perpetualBonds.name: Perpetual Bonds
perpetualBonds.description: Bonds without any maturity date. Interest is paid into eternity if is not terminated.

plainVanillaSwap.name: Plain Vanilla Swap
plainVanillaSwap.description: Plain vanilla swaps where the underlyings are always two identical PAM´s however with one leg fixed and the other variable.
plainVanillaSwap.coverage: More than 90% of all interest rate swaps follow this simple pattern.

principalAtMaturity.name: Principal at Maturity
principalAtMaturity.description: Principal payment fully at Initial Exchange Date (IED) and repaid at Maturity Date (MD). Fixed and variable rates.
principalAtMaturity.coverage: All kind of bonds, term deposits, bullet loans and mortgages etc.

repurchaseAgreement.name: Repurchase Agreement
repurchaseAgreement.description: A Repo contract controls and manages the sale and repurchase of assets on the books.
repurchaseAgreement.coverage: Classical repo and reverse repo agreements.

securitizationCreditRisk.name: Securitization Credit Risk
securitizationCreditRisk.description: Securitiazion contracts where contracs are ranked according to credit default. The lower ranked tranches are hit by the first defaults. Only when the lowest tranches are wiped out, the next higher tranch is hit.

securitizationMarketRisk.name: Securitization Market Risk
securitizationMarketRisk.description: Securitiazion contracts where all underlying contracts are treated equal. The buyer of a tranche gets a part of the cash-flows.
securitizationMarketRisk.coverage: ABS´s, MBS´s of all sorts. Could be a simple tranche or more complex tranch like interest only and principal only.

stock.name: Stock
stock.description: Any instrument which is bought at a certain amount (market price normally) and then follows an index.

swap.name: Swap
swap.description: Exchange of two basic CT´s (PAM, ANN etc.). Normally one is fixed, the other variable. However all variants possible including different currencies for cross currency swaps, basic swaps or even different principal exchange programs.
swap.coverage: All kind of swaps. The variety is defined by the underlying CT´s which often are PAM and ANN in all its flavors. With each new basic CT the variety rises.

totalReturnSwap.name: Total Return Swap
totalReturnSwap.description: A total return swap is a swap agreement in which one party makes payments based on a set rate, either fixed or variable, while the other party makes payments based on the return of an underlying asset, which includes both the income it generates and any capital gains.

undefinedMaturityProfile.name: Undefined Maturity Profile
undefinedMaturityProfile.description: Principal paid in and out at any point in time without prefixed schedule. Interest calculated on outstanding and capitalized periodically. Needs link to a behavioral function describing expected flows.
undefinedMaturityProfile.coverage: Saving products of all kind, current accounts. In some countries even variable rate mortgages can be represented with this CT.

warrant.name: Warrant
warrant.description: Bonds with a warrant. If option is exercised, underlying bond continues to exist.

accruedInterest.name: Accrued Interest
accruedInterest.description: Accrued interest as per SD. In case of NULL, this value will be recalculated using IPANX, IPCL and IPNR information. Can be used to represent irregular next IP payments.

amortizationDate.name: Amortization Date
amortizationDate.description: This Date is used to calculate the annuity amounts for ANN and ANX NGX CT's. Needs only to be set in case where the contract balloon at MD and MD is less than AD.

arrayCycleAnchorDateOfInterestPayment.name: Array Cycle Anchor Date Of Interest Payment
arrayCycleAnchorDateOfInterestPayment.description: Same like IPANX but as array

arrayCycleAnchorDateOfPrincipalRedemptio.name: Array Cycle Anchor Date Of Principal Redemption
arrayCycleAnchorDateOfPrincipalRedemptio.description: Same like PRANX but as array

arrayCycleAnchorDateOfRateReset.name: Array Cycle Anchor Date Of Rate Reset
arrayCycleAnchorDateOfRateReset.description: Same like RRANX but as array

arrayCycleOfInterestPayment.name: Array Cycle Of Interest Payment
arrayCycleOfInterestPayment.description: Same like IPCL but as array

arrayCycleOfPrincipalRedemption.name: Array Cycle Of Principal Redemption
arrayCycleOfPrincipalRedemption.description: Same like PRCL but as array

arrayCycleOfRateReset.name: Array Cycle Of Rate Reset
arrayCycleOfRateReset.description: Same like RRCL but as array

arrayFixedVariable.name: Array Fixed Variable

allowedValues.name: Fixed Rate
allowedValues.description: Rate spread represents a fixed rate.

allowedValues.name: Variable Rate
allowedValues.description: Rate spread represents the spread on top of a reference rate.

arrayFixedVariable.description: For array-type rate reset schedules, this attributes defines the meaning of ARRATE.

arrayIncreaseDecrease.name: Array Increase Decrease

allowedValues.name: Increase
allowedValues.description: Notional is increased in this period.

allowedValues.name: Decrease
allowedValues.description: Notional is decreased in this period.

arrayIncreaseDecrease.description:
Indicates whether a certain PRNXT element in ARPRNX increases the principal (NT) or decreases it.
Applies only for ANX, NAX, LAX Maturity CTs. For all other Maturity CTs the first principal payment is always in the opposite direction of all other (following) payments.

arrayNextPrincipalRedemptionPayment.name: Array Next Principal Redemption Payment
arrayNextPrincipalRedemptionPayment.description: Same like PRNXT but as array

arrayRate.name: Array Rate
arrayRate.description: For array-type rate reset schedules, this attribute represents either an interest rate (corresponding to IPNR) or a spread (corresponding to RRSP). Which case applies depends on the attribute ARFIXVAR: if ARFIXVAR=FIX then it represents the new IPNR and if ARFIXVAR=VAR then the applicable RRSP.

businessDayConvention.name: Business Day Convention

allowedValues.name: No Shift
allowedValues.description: No shift applied to non-business days.

allowedValues.name: Shift-Calculate Following
allowedValues.description: Shift event dates first then calculate accruals etc. Strictly shift to the next following business day.

allowedValues.name: Shift-Calculate Modified-Following
allowedValues.description: Shift event dates first then calculate accruals etc. Shift to the next following business day if this falls in the same month. Shift to the most recent preceding business day otherwise.

allowedValues.name: Calculate-Shift Following
allowedValues.description: Calculate accruals etc. first then shift event dates. Strictly shift to the next following business day.

allowedValues.name: Calculate-Shift Modified-Following
allowedValues.description: Calculate accruals etc. first then shift event dates. Shift to the next following business day if this falls in the same month. Shift to the most recent preceding business day otherwise.

allowedValues.name: Shift-Calculate Preceding
allowedValues.description: Shift event dates first then calculate accruals etc. Strictly shift to the most recent preceding business day.

allowedValues.name: Shift-Calculate Modified-Preceding
allowedValues.description: Shift event dates first then calculate accruals etc. Shift to the most recent preceding business day if this falls in the same month. Shift to the next following business day otherwise.

allowedValues.name: Calculate-Shift Preceding
allowedValues.description: Calculate accruals etc. first then shift event dates. Strictly shift to the most recent preceding business day.

allowedValues.name: Calculate-Shift Modified-Preceding
allowedValues.description: Calculate accruals etc. first then shift event dates. Shift to the most recent preceding business day if this falls in the same month. Shift to the next following business day otherwise.

businessDayConvention.description:
BDC's are linked to a calendar. Calendars have working and non-working days. A BDC value other than N means that cash flows cannot fall on non-working days, they must be shifted to the next business day (following) or the previous on (preceding).
These two simple rules get refined twofold:
- Following modified (preceding): Same like following (preceding), however if a cash flow gets shifted into a new month, then  it is shifted to preceding (following) business day.
- Shift/calculate (SC) and calculate/shift (CS). Accrual, principal, and possibly other calculations are affected by this choice. In the case of SC first the dates are shifted and after the shift cash flows are calculated. In the case of CS it is the other way round.
Attention: Does not affect non-cyclical dates such as PRD, MD, TD, IPCED since they can be set to the correct date directly.

calendar.name: Calendar

allowedValues.name: No Calendar
allowedValues.description: No holidays defined

allowedValues.name: MondayToFriday
allowedValues.description: Saturdays and Sundays are holidays

calendar.description: Calendar defines the non-working days which affect the dates of contract events (CDE's) in combination with EOMC and BDC. Custom calendars can be added as additional enum options.

capitalizationEndDate.name: Capitalization End Date
capitalizationEndDate.description: If IPCED is set, then interest is not paid or received but added to the balance (NT) until IPCED. If IPCED does not coincide with an IP cycle, one additional interest payment gets calculated at IPCED and capitalized. Thereafter normal interest payments occur.

clearingHouse.name: Clearing House

allowedValues.name: Is Clearing House
allowedValues.description: Contract creator is the clearing house.

allowedValues.name: Is Not Clearing House
allowedValues.description: Contract creator is not the clearing house.

clearingHouse.description: Indicates wheter CRID takes a clearing house function or not. In other word, whether CRID receive margins (MRIM, MRVM).

contractDealDate.name: Contract Deal Date
contractDealDate.description: This date signifies the origination of the contract where an agreement between the customer and the bank has been settled. From this date on, the institution will have a (market) risk position for financial contracts. This is even the case when IED is in future.

contractID.name: Contract Identifier
contractID.description:
Unique identifier of a contract.  
If the system is used on a single firm level, an internal unique ID can be generated. If used on a national or globally level, a globally unique ID is required.

contractPerformance.name: Contract Performance

allowedValues.name: Performant
allowedValues.description: Contract is performing according to terms and conditions.

allowedValues.name: Delayed
allowedValues.description: Contractual payment obligations are delayed according to the Grace Period.

allowedValues.name: Delinquent
allowedValues.description: Contractual payment obligations are delinquent according to the Delinquency Period.

allowedValues.name: Default
allowedValues.description: Contract defaulted on payment obligations according to Delinquency Period.

allowedValues.name: Matured
allowedValues.description: Contract matured.

allowedValues.name: Terminated
allowedValues.description: Contract has been terminated.

contractPerformance.description: Indicates the current contract performance status. Different states of the contract range from performing to default.

contractRole.name: Contract Role

allowedValues.name: Real Position Asset
allowedValues.description: Contract creator takes the asset or lender side.

allowedValues.name: Real Position Liability
allowedValues.description: Contract creator takes the liability or borrower side.

allowedValues.name: Receive First Leg
allowedValues.description: Contract creator receives the first leg.

allowedValues.name: Pay First Leg
allowedValues.description: Contract creator pays the first leg.

allowedValues.name: Receive Fix
allowedValues.description: Contract creator receives the fixed leg.

allowedValues.name: Pay Fix
allowedValues.description: Contract creator pays the fixed leg.

allowedValues.name: Buyer
allowedValues.description: Contract creator holds the right to buy the underlying / exercise the option.

allowedValues.name: Seller
allowedValues.description: Contract creator holds the obligation to sell the underlying / deliver the option.

allowedValues.name: Collateral Position
allowedValues.description: Contract represents a collateral to an underlying instrument

allowedValues.name: Close out Netting
allowedValues.description: Contract creator and counterparty agree on netting payment obligations of underlying instruments in case of default.

allowedValues.name: Underlying
allowedValues.description: Contract represents the underlying to a composed contract. Role of the underlying is derived from the parent.

allowedValues.name: Underlying Plus
allowedValues.description: Contract represents the underlying to a composed contract. Role of the underlying is derived from the parent. When considered a standalone contract the underlying’s creator takes the asset side.

allowedValues.name: Underlying Minus
allowedValues.description: Contract represents the underlying to a composed contract. Role of the underlying is derived from the parent. When considered a standalone contract the underlying’s creator takes the liability side.

contractRole.description:
CNTRL defines which position the CRID ( the creator of the contract record ) takes in a contract. For example, whether the contract is an asset or liability, a long or short position for the CRID. 
Most contracts are simple on or off balance sheet positions which are assets, liabilities. Such contracts can also play a secondary role as a collateral. 
The attribute is highly significant since it determines the direction of all cash flows. The exact meaning is given with each CT in the ACTUS High Level Specification document.

contractStructure.name: Contract Structure
contractStructure.description: A structure identifying individual or sets of underlying contracts. E.g. for FUTUR, this structure identifies the single underlying contract, for SWAPS, the FirstLeg and SecondLeg are identified, or for CEG, CEC the structure identifies Covered and Covering contracts.

contractType.name: Contract Type

allowedValues.name: Principal at Maturity
allowedValues.description: Lending agreements with full amortization at maturity.

allowedValues.name: Annuity
allowedValues.description: Lending agreements with fixed periodic payments consisting of an interest and principal portion. The periodic payments are adjusted for variable rate instruments such that maturity remains fixed.

allowedValues.name: Negative Amortizer
allowedValues.description: Lending agreements with fixed periodic payments consisting of an interest and principal portion. Maturity changes for variable rate instruments.

allowedValues.name: Linear Amortizer
allowedValues.description: Lending agreements with fixed principal repayment amounts and variable interest payments.

allowedValues.name: Exotic Linear Amortizer
allowedValues.description: Lending agreements with exotic repayment schedules.

allowedValues.name: Call Money
allowedValues.description: Lonas that are rolled over as long as they are not called. Once called it has to be paid back after the stipulated notice period.

allowedValues.name: Undefined Maturity Profile
allowedValues.description: Interest paying cash accounts (current / savings / etc.).

allowedValues.name: Cash
allowedValues.description: Represents cash holdings.

allowedValues.name: Stock
allowedValues.description: Represents stocks/shares/equity.

allowedValues.name: Commodity
allowedValues.description: Represents commodities.

allowedValues.name: Swap
allowedValues.description: An agreement of swapping two legs such as fixed against variable or currency 1 against currency 2 etc.

allowedValues.name: Plain Vanilla Swap
allowedValues.description: Plain vanilla interest rate swaps.

allowedValues.name: Foreign Exchange Outright
allowedValues.description: An agreement of swapping two cash flows in different currencies at a future point in time.

allowedValues.name: Cap and Floor
allowedValues.description: An agreement of paying the differential (cap or floor) of a reference rate versus a fixed rate.

allowedValues.name: Future
allowedValues.description: An agreement of exchanging an underlying instrument against a fixed price in the future.

allowedValues.name: Option
allowedValues.description: Different types of options on buying an underlying instrument at a fixed price in the future.

allowedValues.name: Credit Enhancement Guarantee
allowedValues.description: A guarantee / letter of credit by a third party on the scheduled payment obligations of an underlying instrument

allowedValues.name: Credit Enhancement Collateral
allowedValues.description: A collateral securing the scheduled payment obligations of an underlying instrument

contractType.description: The ContractType is the most important information. It defines the cash flow generating pattern of a contract. The ContractType information in combination with a given state of the risk factors will produce a deterministic sequence of cash flows which are the basis of any financial analysis.

counterpartyID.name: Counterparty Identifier
counterpartyID.description:
CPID identifies the counterparty to the CRID in this contract.
CPID is ideally the official LEI which can be a firm, a government body, even a single person etc. However, this can also refer to a annonymous group in which case this information is not to be disclosed. CPID may also refer to a group taking a joint risk or more generally, CPID is the main counterparty, against which the contract has been settled.

coverageOfCreditEnhancement.name: Coverage Of Credit Enhancement
coverageOfCreditEnhancement.description: Defines which percentage of the exposure is covered

creatorID.name: Creator Identifier
creatorID.description:
This identifies the legal entity creating the contract record. The counterparty of the contract is tracked in CPID.
CRID is ideally the official LEI which can be a firm, a government body, even a single person etc. However, this can also refer to a annonymous group in which case this information is not to be disclosed. CRID may also refer to a group taking a joint risk.

creditEventTypeCovered.name: Credit Event Type Covered

allowedValues.name: Delayed
allowedValues.description: Delay of the underlying represents a credit event.

allowedValues.name: Delinquent
allowedValues.description: Delinquency of the underlying represents a credit event.

allowedValues.name: Default
allowedValues.description: Default of the underlying represents a credit event.

creditEventTypeCovered.description: The type of credit events covered e.g. in credit enhancement or credit default swap contracts. Only the defined credit event types may trigger the protection.

creditLineAmount.name: Credit Line Amount
creditLineAmount.description:
If defined, gives the total amount that can be drawn from a credit line. The remaining amount that can still be drawn is given by CLA-NT.
For ANN, NAM, the credit line can only be drawn prior to PRANX-1PRCL.
For CRL, the remaining amount that can still be drawn is given by CLA-Sum(NT of attached contracts).

currency.name: Currency
currency.description: The currency of the cash flows.

currency2.name: Currency 2
currency2.description: The currency of the cash flows of the second leg (if not defined, main currency applies)

cycleAnchorDateOfDividend.name: Cycle Anchor Date Of Dividend
cycleAnchorDateOfDividend.description: Date from which the dividend payment date schedule is calculated according to the cycle length. The first dividend payment event takes place on this anchor.

cycleAnchorDateOfFee.name: Cycle Anchor Date Of Fee
cycleAnchorDateOfFee.description: Date from which the fee payment date schedule is calculated according to the cycle length. The first fee payment event takes place on this anchor.

cycleAnchorDateOfInterestCalculationBase.name: Cycle Anchor Date Of Interest Calculation Base
cycleAnchorDateOfInterestCalculationBase.description: Date from which the interest calculation base date schedule is calculated according to the cycle length. The first interest calculation base event takes place on this anchor.

cycleAnchorDateOfInterestPayment.name: Cycle Anchor Date Of Interest Payment
cycleAnchorDateOfInterestPayment.description: Date from which the interest payment date schedule is calculated according to the cycle length. The first interest payment event takes place on this anchor.

cycleAnchorDateOfMargining.name: Cycle Anchor Date Of Margining
cycleAnchorDateOfMargining.description: Date from which the margin call date schedule is calculated according to the cycle length. The first margin call event takes place on this anchor.

cycleAnchorDateOfOptionality.name: Cycle Anchor Date Of Optionality
cycleAnchorDateOfOptionality.description:
Used for Basic Maturities (such as PAM, RGM, ANN, NGM and their Step-up versions) and American and Bermudan style options. 
- Basic Maturities: Within the group of these Maturities, it indicates the possibility of prepayments. Prepayment features are controlled by Behavior. 
- American and Bermudan style Options: Begin of exercise period.

cycleAnchorDateOfPrincipalRedemption.name: Cycle Anchor Date Of Principal Redemption
cycleAnchorDateOfPrincipalRedemption.description: Date from which the principal payment date schedule is calculated according to the cycle length. The first principal payment event takes place on this anchor.

cycleAnchorDateOfRateReset.name: Cycle Anchor Date Of Rate Reset
cycleAnchorDateOfRateReset.description: Date from which the rate reset date schedule is calculated according to the cycle length. The first rate reset event takes place on this anchor.

cycleAnchorDateOfScalingIndex.name: Cycle Anchor Date Of Scaling Index
cycleAnchorDateOfScalingIndex.description: Date from which the scaling date schedule is calculated according to the cycle length. The first scaling event takes place on this anchor.

cycleOfDividend.name: Cycle Of Dividend
cycleOfDividend.description: Defines in combination with DVANX the payment points of dividends. The dividend payment schedule will start at DVANX and end at MaximumProjectionPeriod (cf. sheet Modeling Parameters).

cycleOfFee.name: Cycle Of Fee
cycleOfFee.description: Defines in combination with FEANX the payment points of fees

cycleOfInterestCalculationBase.name: Cycle Of Interest Calculation Base
cycleOfInterestCalculationBase.description:
Concerning the format see PRCL. 
Defines the subsequent adjustment points to NT of the interest payment calculation base.

cycleOfInterestPayment.name: Cycle Of Interest Payment
cycleOfInterestPayment.description:
Cycle according to which the interest payment date schedule will be calculated.
In case IPCL is not set, then there will only be an interest payment event at MD (and possibly at IPANX if set).
The interval will be adjusted yet by EOMC and BDC.

cycleOfMargining.name: Cycle Of Margining
cycleOfMargining.description: Defines together with MRANX the points where margins can be called.

cycleOfOptionality.name: Cycle Of Optionality
cycleOfOptionality.description:
Cycle according to which the option exercise date schedule will be calculated.
OPCL can be NULL for American Options or Prepayment Optionality in which case the optionality period starts at OPANX and ends at OPXED (for american options) or MD (in case of prepayment optionality).
The interval will be adjusted yet by EOMC and BDC.

cycleOfPrincipalRedemption.name: Cycle Of Principal Redemption
cycleOfPrincipalRedemption.description:
Cycle according to which the interest payment date schedule will be calculated.
In case PRCL is not set, then there will only be one principal payment event at MD (and possibly at PRANX if set).
The interval will be adjusted yet by EOMC and BDC.

cycleOfRateReset.name: Cycle Of Rate Reset
cycleOfRateReset.description:
Cycle according to which the rate reset date schedule will be calculated.
In case RRCL is not set, then there will only be one rate reset event at RRANX given RRANX if set.
The interval will be adjusted yet by EOMC and BDC.

cycleOfScalingIndex.name: Cycle Of Scaling Index
cycleOfScalingIndex.description:
Cycle according to which the scaling date schedule will be calculated.
In case SCCL is not set, then there will only be one scaling event at SCANX given SCANX is set.
The interval will be adjusted yet by EOMC and BDC.

cyclePointOfInterestPayment.name: Cycle Point Of Interest Payment

allowedValues.name: Beginning
allowedValues.description: Interest is paid upfront of the interest period.

allowedValues.name: End
allowedValues.description: Interest is paid at the end of the interest period.

cyclePointOfInterestPayment.description: Usually, interest is paid at the end of each IPCL which corresponds to a IPPNT value of E which is also the default. If interest payment occurs at the beginning of the cycle, the value is B.

cyclePointOfRateReset.name: Cycle Point Of Rate Reset

allowedValues.name: Beginning
allowedValues.description: The new rate is applied at the beginning of the reset period.

allowedValues.name: End
allowedValues.description: The new rate is applied at the end of the reset period.

cyclePointOfRateReset.description: Normally rates get reset at the beginning of any resetting cycles. There are contracts where the rate is not set at the beginning but at the end of the cycle and then applied to the previous cycle (post-fixing); in other words the rate applies before it is fixed. Hence, the new rate is not known during the entire cycle where it applies. Therefore, the rate will be applied backwards at the end of the cycle. This happens through a correction of interest accrued.

dayCountConvention.name: Day Count Convention

allowedValues.name: Actual/Actual
allowedValues.description: Year fractions accrue on the basis of the actual number of days per month and per year in the respective period.

allowedValues.name: Actual Three Sixty
allowedValues.description: Year fractions accrue on the basis of the actual number of days per month and 360 days per year in the respective period.

allowedValues.name: Actual Three Sixty Five
allowedValues.description: Year fractions accrue on the basis of the actual number of days per month and 365 days per year in the respective period.

allowedValues.name: Thirty E Three Sixty ISDA
allowedValues.description: Year fractions accrue on the basis of 30 days per month and 360 days per year in the respective period (ISDA method).

allowedValues.name: Thirty E Three Sixty
allowedValues.description: Year fractions accrue on the basis of 30 days per month and 360 days per year in the respective period.

allowedValues.name: Twenty Eight E Three Thirty Six
allowedValues.description: Year fractions accrue on the basis of 28 days per month and 336 days per year in the respective period.

dayCountConvention.description: Method defining how days are counted between two dates. This finally defines the year fraction in accrual calculations.

delinquencyPeriod.name: Delinquency Period
delinquencyPeriod.description: If real payment happens after scheduled payment date plus DLP, then the counterparty is in technical default. This means that the creditor legally has the right to declare default of the debtor.

delinquencyRate.name: Delinquency Rate
delinquencyRate.description: Rate at which Delinquency Payments accrue on NT (in addition to the interest rate) during the DelinquencyPeriod

deliverySettlement.name: Delivery Settlement

allowedValues.name: Cash Settlement
allowedValues.description: The market value of the underlying is settled.

allowedValues.name: Physical Settlement
allowedValues.description: The underlying is delivered physically.

deliverySettlement.description:
Indicates whether the contract is settled in cash or physical delivery.
In case of physical delivery, the underlying contract and associated (future) cash flows are effectively exchanged. In case of cash settlement, the current market value of the underlying contract determines the cash flow exchanged.

endOfMonthConvention.name: End Of Month Convention

allowedValues.name: Same Day
allowedValues.description: Schedule times always fall on the schedule anchor date day of the month.

allowedValues.name: End of Month
allowedValues.description: Schedule times fall on the end of every month if the anchor date represents the last day of the respective month.

endOfMonthConvention.description:
When computing schedules a special problem arises if an anchor date is at the end of a month and a cycle of monthly or quarterly is applied (yearly in the case of leap years only). How do we have to interpret an anchor date April 30 plus 1M cycles? In case where EOM is selected, it will jump to the 31st of May, then June 30, July 31 and so on. If SM is selected, it will jump to the 30st always with of course an exception in February. 
This logic applies for all months having 30 or less days and an anchor date at the last day. Month with 31 days will at any rate jump to the last of the month if anchor date is on the last day.

exDividendDate.name: Ex Dividend Date
exDividendDate.description: In case contract is traded between DVEX and next DV payment date (i.e. PRD>DVEX & PRD<next DV payment date), then the old holder of the contract (previous to the trade) receives the next DV payment. In other words, the next DV payment is cancelled for the new (after the trade) holder of the contract.

exerciseAmount.name: Exercise Amount
exerciseAmount.description: The amount fixed at Exercise Date for a contingent event/obligation such as a forward condition, optionality etc. The Exercise Amount is fixed at Exercise Date but not settled yet.

exerciseDate.name: Exercise Date
exerciseDate.description: Date of exercising a contingent event/obligation such as a forward condition, optionality etc. The Exercise date marks the observed timestamp of fixing the contingent event and respective payment obligation not necessarily the timestamp of settling the obligation.

feeBasis.name: Fee Basis

allowedValues.name: Absolute Value
allowedValues.description: The fee rate represents an absolute value.

allowedValues.name: Nominal Value of the Underlying
allowedValues.description: The fee rate represents a rate that accrues fees on the basis of the nominal value of the underlying.

feeBasis.description: Basis, on which Fee is calculated. For FEB=’A’, FER is interpreted as an absolute amount to be paid at every FP event and for FEB=’N’, FER represents a rate at which FP amounts accrue on the basis of the contract’s NT.

feeRate.name: Fee Rate
feeRate.description: Rate of Fee which is a percentage of the underlying or FER is an absolute amount. For all contracts where FEB does not apply (cf. business rules), FER is interpreted as an absolute amount.

fixingPeriod.name: Fixing Period
fixingPeriod.description: Interest rate resets (adjustments) are usually fixed one or two days (usually Business Days) before the new rate applies (defined by the rate reset schedule). This field holds the period between fixing and application of a rate.

futuresPrice.name: Futures Price
futuresPrice.description: The price the counterparties agreed upon at which the underlying contract (of a FUTUR) is exchanged/settled at STD. Quoting is different for different types of underlyings: Fixed Income = in percentage, all others in nominal terms.

gracePeriod.name: Grace Period
gracePeriod.description: If real payment happens after scheduled payment date plus GRP, then the payment is in delay.

guaranteedExposure.name: Guaranteed Exposure

allowedValues.name: Nominal Value
allowedValues.description: Nominal value of the exposure is covered.

allowedValues.name: Nominal Value plus Interest
allowedValues.description: Nominal value of the exposure plus interest accrued is covered.

allowedValues.name: Market Value
allowedValues.description: Market value of the exposure is covered.

guaranteedExposure.description:
Defines which value of the exposure is covered:
- NO: Nominal Value
- NI: Nominal plus Interest
- MV: Market Value

initialExchangeDate.name: Initial Exchange Date
initialExchangeDate.description: Date of the initial cash flow for Maturity and Non-Maturity CT's. It also coincides with the beginning of interest accrual calculation.

initialMargin.name: Initial Margin
initialMargin.description:
Margin to cover losses which may be incurred as a result of market fluctuations. 
Upon contract closing or maturity, the MRIM is reimbursed.

interestCalculationBase.name: Interest Calculation Base

allowedValues.name: Notional Outstanding
allowedValues.description: Interest accrues on the basis of the notional outstanding.

allowedValues.name: Notional at Initial Exchange
allowedValues.description: Interest accrues on the basis of the notional value at initial exchange.

allowedValues.name: Notional Outstanding Lagged
allowedValues.description: Interest accrues on the basis of the lagged notional outstanding.

interestCalculationBase.description:
This is important for amortizing instruments. The basis of interest calculation is normally the notional outstanding amount as per SD. This is considered the fair basis and in many countries the only legal basis. If NULL or NTSD is selected, this is the case. 
Alternative bases (normally in order to favor the lending institution) are found. In the extreme case the original balance (PCDD=NT+PDCDD) never gets adjusted. In this case PCDD must be chosen. 
An intermediate case exist wherre balances do get adjusted, however with lags. In this case NTL mut be selected and anchor dates and cycles must be set.

interestCalculationBaseAmount.name: Interest Calculation Base Amount
interestCalculationBaseAmount.description: This is the amount used for the calculation of interest. Calculation base per SD.

interestScalingMultiplier.name: Interest Scaling Multiplier
interestScalingMultiplier.description: The multiplier being applied to interest cash flows

lifeCap.name: Life Cap
lifeCap.description:
For variable rate basic CTs this represents a cap on the interest rate that applies during the entire lifetime of the contract.
For CAPFL CTs this represents the cap strike rate.

lifeFloor.name: Life Floor
lifeFloor.description:
For variable rate basic CTs this represents a floor on the interest rate that applies during the entire lifetime of the contract.
For CAPFL CTs this represents the floor strike rate.

maintenanceMarginLowerBound.name: Maintenance Margin Lower Bound
maintenanceMarginLowerBound.description: Defines the lower bound of the Maintenance Margin. If MRVM falls below MRMML, then capital must be added to reach the original MRIM.

maintenanceMarginUpperBound.name: Maintenance Margin Upper Bound
maintenanceMarginUpperBound.description: Defines the upper bound of the Maintenance Margin. If MRVM falls above MRMMU, then capital is refunded to reach the original MRIM.

marketObjectCode.name: Market Object Code
marketObjectCode.description:
Is pointing to the market value at SD (MarketObject).
Unique codes for market objects must be used.

marketObjectCodeOfRateReset.name: Market Object Code Of Rate Reset
marketObjectCodeOfRateReset.description:
Is pointing to the interest rate driver (MarketObject) used for rate reset uniquely.
Unique codes for market objects must be used.

marketObjectCodeOfScalingIndex.name: Market Object Code Of Scaling Index

marketValueObserved.name: Market Value Observed
marketValueObserved.description: Value as observed in the market at SD per unit. Incase of fixed income instruments it is a fraction.

maturityDate.name: Maturity Date
maturityDate.description:
Marks the contractual end of the lifecycle of a CT. Generally, date of the last cash flows. 
This includes normally a principal and an interest payment. Some Maturity CTs as perpetuals (PBN) do not have such a date. For variable amortizing contracts of the ANN CT, this date might be less than the scheduled end of the contract (which is deduced from the periodic payment amount 
PRNXT). In this case it balloons.

maximumPenaltyFreeDisbursement.name: Maximum Penalty Free Disbursement
maximumPenaltyFreeDisbursement.description: Defines the notional amount which can be withdrawn before XDN without penalty

nextDividendPaymentAmount.name: Next Dividend Payment Amount
nextDividendPaymentAmount.description: Defines the next dividend payment (amount) whereas the date of dividend payment is defined through the DVANX/DVCL pair. If DVCL is defined, then this amount will be used as dividend payment for each future dividend payment date.

nextPrincipalRedemptionPayment.name: Next Principal Redemption Payment
nextPrincipalRedemptionPayment.description: Amount of principal that will be paid during the redemption cycle at the next payment date. For amortizing contracts like ANN, NAM, ANX, and NAX this is the total periodic payment amount (sum of interest and principal).

nextResetRate.name: Next Reset Rate
nextResetRate.description: Holds the new rate that has been fixed already (cf. attribute FixingDays) but not applied. This new rate will be applied at the next rate reset event (after SD and according to the rate reset schedule). Attention, RRNXT must be set to NULL after it is applied!

nominalInterestRate.name: Nominal Interest Rate
nominalInterestRate.description:
The nominal interest rate which will be used to calculate accruals and the next interest payment at the next IP date. NT multiplied with IPNR is the base for the interest payment calculation. The relevant time period is a function of IPDC. 
If the contract is variable (RRANX set) this field is periodically updated per SD. 
In the case of plan vanilla interest rate swaps (IRSPV) this defines the rate of fixed leg.

nominalInterestRate2.name: Nominal Interest Rate 2
nominalInterestRate2.description:
The nominal interest rate which will be used to calculate accruals and the next interest payment at the next IP date on the second leg (the one not mentioned in CNTRL) of a plain vanilla swap. The relevant time period is a function of IPDC. 
It is periodically updated per SD.

nonPerformingDate.name: Non Performing Date
nonPerformingDate.description: The date of the (uncovered) payment event responsible for the current value of the Contract Performance attribute.

notionalPrincipal.name: Notional Principal
notionalPrincipal.description:
Current nominal value of the contract. For debt instrument this is the current remaining notional outstanding. 
NT is generally the basis on which interest payments are calculated. If IPCBS is set, IPCBS may introduce a different basis for interest payment calculation.

notionalPrincipal2.name: Notional Principal 2
notionalPrincipal2.description: Notional amount of the second currency to be exchanged in an FXOUT CT.

notionalScalingMultiplier.name: Notional Scaling Multiplier
notionalScalingMultiplier.description: The multiplier being applied to principal cash flows

optionExerciseEndDate.name: Option Exercise End Date
optionExerciseEndDate.description: Final exercise date for American and Bermudan options, expiry date for European options.

optionExerciseType.name: Option Exercise Type

allowedValues.name: European
allowedValues.description: European-type exercise.

allowedValues.name: Bermudan
allowedValues.description: Bermudan-type exercise.

allowedValues.name: American
allowedValues.description: American-type exercise.

optionExerciseType.description: Defines whether the option is European (exercised at a specific date), American (exercised during a span of time) or Bermudan (exercised at certain points during a span of time).

optionStrike1.name: Option Strike 1
optionStrike1.description:
Strike price of the option. Whether it is a call/put is determined by the attribute OPTP, i.e a call or a put (or a combination of call/put).
This attribute is used for price related options such as options on bonds, stocks or FX. Interest rate related options (caps/floos) are handled within th RatReset group.

optionStrike2.name: Option Strike 2
optionStrike2.description: Put price in case of call/put.

optionType.name: Option Type

allowedValues.name: Call
allowedValues.description: Call option.

allowedValues.name: Put
allowedValues.description: Put option.

allowedValues.name: Call-Put
allowedValues.description: Combination of call and put option.

optionType.description: Defines whether the option is a call or put or a combination of it. This field has to be seen in combination with CNTRL where it is defined whether CRID is the buyer or the seller.

penaltyRate.name: Penalty Rate
penaltyRate.description: Either the rate or the absolute amount of the prepayment.

penaltyType.name: Penalty Type

allowedValues.name: No Penalty
allowedValues.description: No penalty applies.

allowedValues.name: Fixed Penalty
allowedValues.description: A fixed amount applies as penalty.

allowedValues.name: Relative Penalty
allowedValues.description: A penalty relative to the notional outstanding applies.

allowedValues.name: Interest Rate Differential
allowedValues.description: A penalty based on the current interest rate differential relative to the notional outstanding applies.

penaltyType.description: Defines whether prepayment is linked to a penalty and of which kind.

periodCap.name: Period Cap
periodCap.description: For variable rate basic CTs this represents the maximum positive rate change per rate reset cycle.

periodFloor.name: Period Floor
periodFloor.description: For variable rate basic CTs this represents the maximum negative rate change per rate reset cycle.

premiumDiscountAtIED.name: Premium Discount At IED
premiumDiscountAtIED.description:
Total original premium or discount that has been set at CDD and will be added to the (notional) cash flow at IED (cash flow at IED = NT+PDIED, w.r.t. an RPA CT). 
Negative value for discount and positive for premium.
Note, similar to interest the PDIED portion is part of P&L.

prepaymentEffect.name: Prepayment Effect

allowedValues.name: No Prepayment
allowedValues.description: Prepayment is not allowed under the agreement.

allowedValues.name: Prepayment Reduces Redemption Amount
allowedValues.description: Prepayment is allowed and reduces the redemption amount for the remaining period up to maturity.

allowedValues.name: Prepayment Reduces Maturity
allowedValues.description: Prepayment is allowed and reduces the maturity.

prepaymentEffect.description: This attribute defines whether or not the right of prepayment exists and if yes, how prepayment affects the remaining principal redemption schedule of the contract

prepaymentPeriod.name: Prepayment Period
prepaymentPeriod.description: If real payment happens before scheduled payment date minus PPP, then it is considered a prepayment. Effect of prepayments are further described in PPEF and related fields.

priceAtPurchaseDate.name: Price At Purchase Date
priceAtPurchaseDate.description:
Purchase price exchanged at PRD.  
PPRD represents a clean price (includes premium/discount but not IPAC).

priceAtTerminationDate.name: Price At Termination Date
priceAtTerminationDate.description: Sellingprice exchanged at PTD  PTDrepresents a clean price (includes premium/discount but not IPAC

purchaseDate.name: Purchase Date
purchaseDate.description:
If a contract is bought after initiation (for example a bond on the secondary market) this date has to be set. It refers to the date at which the payment (of PPRD) and transfer of the security happens. In other words, PRD - if set - takes the role otherwise IED has from a cash flow perspective. 
Note, CPID of the CT is not the counterparty of the transaction!

quantity.name: Quantity
quantity.description:
This attribute relates either to physical contracts (COM) or underlyings of traded contracts. 
In case of physical contracts it holds the number of underlying units of the specific good (e.g. number of barrels of oil). 
In case of well defined traded contracts it holds the number of defined underlying instruments. Example: QT of STK CTs underlying a FUTUR indicates the number of those specific STK CTs which underlie the FUTUR.

rateMultiplier.name: Rate Multiplier
rateMultiplier.description:
Interest rate multiplier. A typical rate resetting rule is LIBOR plus x basis point where x represents the interest rate spread.
However, in some cases like reverse or super floater contracts an additional rate multiplier applies. In this case, the new rate is determined as: IPNR after rate reset = Rate selected from the market object * RRMLT + RRSP.

rateSpread.name: Rate Spread
rateSpread.description:
Interest rate spread. A typical rate resetting rule is LIBOR plus x basis point where x represents the interest rate spread.  
The following equation can be taken if RRMLT is not set: IPNR after rate reset = Rate selected from the market object  + RRSP.

scalingEffect.name: Scaling Effect

allowedValues.name: No Scaling
allowedValues.description: No scaling applies.

allowedValues.name: Interest is Scaled
allowedValues.description: Scaling applies only to interest.

allowedValues.name: Principal is Scaled
allowedValues.description: Scaling applies only to principal.

allowedValues.name: Interest and Principal is Scaled
allowedValues.description: Scaling applies to interest and principal.

scalingEffect.description: Indicates which payments are scaled. I = Interest payments, N = Nominal payments and M = Maximum deferred interest amount. They can be scaled in any combination.

scalingIndexAtContractDealDate.name: Scaling Index At Contract Deal Date
scalingIndexAtContractDealDate.description: The value of the Scaling Index as per Contract Deal Date.

seniority.name: Seniority

allowedValues.name: Senior
allowedValues.description: Contract represents senior debt.

allowedValues.name: Junior
allowedValues.description: Contract represents junior debt.

seniority.description: Refers to the order of repayment in the event of a sale or default of the issuer.

settlementCurrency.name: Settlement Currency
settlementCurrency.description:
The currency in which cash flows are settled. This currency can be different from the currency (CUR) in which cash flows or the contract, respectively, is denominated in which case the respective FX-rate applies at settlement time.
If no settlement currency is defined the cash flows are settled in the currency in which they are denominated.

settlementPeriod.name: Settlement Period
settlementPeriod.description: Defines the period from fixing of a contingent event/obligation (Exercise Date) to settlement of the obligation.

statusDate.name: Status Date
statusDate.description: SD holds the date per which all attributes of the record were updated. This is especially important for the highly dynamic attributes like Accruals, Notional, interest rates in variable instruments etc.

terminationDate.name: Termination Date
terminationDate.description:
If a contract is sold before MD (for example a bond on the secondary market) this date has to be set. It refers to the date at which the payment (of PTD) and transfer of the security happens. In other words, TD - if set - takes the role otherwise MD has from a cash flow perspective. 
Note, CPID of the CT is not the counterparty of the transaction!

unit.name: Unit

allowedValues.name: Barrel
allowedValues.description: Physical unit of the contract is Barrels.

allowedValues.name: Bushel
allowedValues.description: Physical unit of the contract is Bushel.

allowedValues.name: Gallon
allowedValues.description: Physical unit of the contract is Gallons.

allowedValues.name: Currency Unit
allowedValues.description: Physical unit of the contract is Currency Units.

allowedValues.name: Mega Watt Hours
allowedValues.description: Physical unit of the contract is Mega Watt Hours.

allowedValues.name: Pounds
allowedValues.description: Physical unit of the contract is Pounds.

allowedValues.name: Short Tons
allowedValues.description: Physical unit of the contract is Short Tons.

allowedValues.name: Tons
allowedValues.description: Physical unit of the contract is Tons.

allowedValues.name: Troy Ounce
allowedValues.description: Physical unit of the contract is Troy Ounces.

unit.description: The physical unit of the contract. Example: Barrels for an Oil COM CT.

variationMargin.name: Variation Margin
variationMargin.description:
MRVM reflects the accrued but not yet paid margin as per SD.  
Open traded positions are revalued by the exchange at the end of every trading day using mark-to-market valuation. Often clearing members do not credit or debit their clients daily with MRVM, but rather use a Maintenance Margin. If the balance falls outside MRMML (and MRMMU), then  capital must be added (is refunded) to reach the original margin amount MRIM. We can also say that MVO+MRVM is equal to the reference value as per last margin update.

xDayNotice.name: X Day Notice
xDayNotice.description: Used as rolling attribute with the callable CT's UMP and CLM uniquely. CLM's and UMP's will not be settled (MD not set) until the client uses his option to call the contract X_Day_Notice after Current Date. As long as MD or TD is not set, the client postpones his right to call to the future. The cycle is normally defined in number of business days.

accruedInterest.name: Accrued Interest
accruedInterest.description: The current value of accrued interest

accruedInterest2.name: Accrued Interest 2
accruedInterest2.description: The current value of accrued interest of the second leg

contractPerformance.name: Contract Performance
contractPerformance.description: Indicates the current Contract Performance status. Different states of the contract range from performing to default.

allowedValues.name: Performant
allowedValues.description: Contract is performing according to terms and conditions.

allowedValues.name: Delayed
allowedValues.description: Contractual payment obligations are delayed according to the Grace Period.

allowedValues.name: Delinquent
allowedValues.description: Contractual payment obligations are delinquent according to the Delinquency Period.

allowedValues.name: Default
allowedValues.description: Contract defaulted on payment obligations according to Delinquency Period.

allowedValues.name: Matured
allowedValues.description: Contract matured.

allowedValues.name: Terminated
allowedValues.description: Contract has been terminated.

exerciseAmount.name: Exercise Amount
exerciseAmount.description: The amount fixed for a the contingent event/obligation exercised at Exercise Date

exerciseDate.name: Exercise Date
exerciseDate.description: The timestamp at which a contingent event/obligation is exercised

feeAccrued.name: Fee Accrued
feeAccrued.description: The current value of accrued fees

interestCalculationBaseAmount.name: Interest Calculation Base Amount
interestCalculationBaseAmount.description: The basis at which interest is being accrued. Potentially different from NVL.

interestScalingMultiplier.name: Interest Scaling Multiplier
interestScalingMultiplier.description: The multiplier being applied to interest cash flows

maturityDate.name: Maturity Date
maturityDate.description: The timestamp as per which the contract matures according to the initial terms or as per unscheduled events

nextPrincipalRedemptionPayment.name: Next Principal Redemption Payment
nextPrincipalRedemptionPayment.description: The value at which principal is being repaid. This may be including or excluding of interest depending on the Contract Type

nonPerformingDate.name: Non Performing Date
nonPerformingDate.description: The date of the (uncovered) payment event responsible for the current value of the Contract Performance state variable.

notionalPrincipal2.name: Notional Principal 2
notionalPrincipal2.description: The outstanding nominal value of the second leg

notionalScalingMultiplier.name: Notional Scaling Multiplier
notionalScalingMultiplier.description: The multiplier being applied to principal cash flows

statusDate.name: Status Date
statusDate.description: The timestamp as per which the state is captured at any point in time

terminationDate.name: Termination Date
terminationDate.description: The timestamp of unscheduled termination of a contract

contractID.name: Contract ID
contractID.description: The Contract ID of the contract which created the event.

currency.name: Currency
currency.description: The currency in which the event payoff is scheduled

eventType.name: Event Type
eventType.description: The type of the event. Different types have their own business logic in terms of payoff and state transition functions

allowedValues.name: Monitoring
allowedValues.description: Monitoring of contract. Evaluates all contract states

allowedValues.name: Initial Exchange
allowedValues.description: Scheduled date of initial exchange of e.g. principal value in fixed income products

allowedValues.name: Fee Payment
allowedValues.description: Scheduled fee payments

allowedValues.name: Principal Redemption
allowedValues.description: Scheduled principal redemption payment

allowedValues.name: Principal Drawing
allowedValues.description: Drawing of principal amount e.g. in a credit line

allowedValues.name: Principal Payment Amount Fixing
allowedValues.description: Scheduled fixing of principal payment amount

allowedValues.name: Penalty Payment
allowedValues.description: Scheduled payment of a penalty

allowedValues.name: Principal Prepayment
allowedValues.description: Unscheduled early repayment of principal

allowedValues.name: Interest Payment
allowedValues.description: Scheduled interest payment

allowedValues.name: Interest Capitalization
allowedValues.description: Scheduled capitalization of accrued interest

allowedValues.name: Credit Event
allowedValues.description: Credit event of counterparty to a contract

allowedValues.name: Rate Reset Fixing with Known Rate
allowedValues.description: Scheduled fixing of variable rate with known new rate

allowedValues.name: Rate Reset Fixing with Unknown Rate
allowedValues.description: Scheduled fixing of variable rate with unknown new rate

allowedValues.name: Dividend Payment
allowedValues.description: Payment of dividends

allowedValues.name: Purchase
allowedValues.description: Purchase of a contract

allowedValues.name: Margin Call
allowedValues.description: Scheduled margin call

allowedValues.name: Termination
allowedValues.description: Termination of a contract

allowedValues.name: Scaling Index Fixing
allowedValues.description: Scheduled fixing of a scaling index

allowedValues.name: Interest Calculation Base Fixing
allowedValues.description: Scheduled fixing of the interest calculation base

allowedValues.name: Maturity
allowedValues.description: Maturity of a contract

allowedValues.name: Exercise
allowedValues.description: Exercise of a contractual feature such as an optionality

allowedValues.name: Settlement
allowedValues.description: Settlement of an exercised contractual claim

payoff.name: Payoff
payoff.description: The event payoff (if any). Is zero if no payoff needs be settled for the event

scheduleTime.name: Schedule Time
scheduleTime.description: The scheduled timestamp for updating event payoff and post-event state

state.name: State
state.description: The post-event state. Results from applying the event’s state transition function to the pre-event state

role.name: Reference Role
role.description: The role of the referencing object

allowedValues.name: Underlying
allowedValues.description: The reference represents a simple underlyer contract

allowedValues.name: First Leg
allowedValues.description: The reference represents the first leg contract

allowedValues.name: Second Leg
allowedValues.description: The reference represents the second leg contract

allowedValues.name: Covered Contract
allowedValues.description: The reference represents a contract that is covered under the parent contract

allowedValues.name: Covering Contract
allowedValues.description: The reference represents a contract that covers for covering contracts under the parent contract Contract

type.name: Reference Type
type.description: The type of the referencing object

allowedValues.name: Contract
allowedValues.description: The reference represents an actual contract

allowedValues.name: Contract Identifier
allowedValues.description: The reference represents an identifier of an actual contract

allowedValues.name: Market Object Identifier
allowedValues.description: The reference represents the identifier of a market object

allowedValues.name: Legal Entity Identifier
allowedValues.description: The reference represents the identifier of a legal entity

allowedValues.name: Contract Structure
allowedValues.description: The reference represents a ContractStructure
